FuncDef:
The eth-test enable command enables the ETH-test function.
The undo eth-test enable command disables the ETH-test function.
By default, the ETH-test function is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a MEP on which the ETH-test function is to be enabled.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8191.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
On a newly built network, an ETH-test instance can be configured to test unidirectional on-demand services or diagnose on-demand-service interruptions. The test can verify the maximum bandwidth and bit error rate. To enable the ETH-test function, run the eth-test enable command.
Prerequisites
CFM has been enabled globally using the cfm enable command in the system view.An MD has been created using the cfm md command in the system view.An MA has been created using the ma command in the MD view.An inward-facing MEP has been created using the mep mep-id command in the MA view.

Precautions
Running this eth-test start command to start a test affects network service transmission.
